extendedIngredients.name: bittersweet chocolate
extendedIngredients.original: 3 ozs semisweet or bittersweet chocolate, chopped

title: Chocolate Amaranth Pudding + Thermador Steamy Soiree
summary: Chocolate Amaranth Pudding + Thermador Steamy Soiree is a gluten free, dairy free, and fodmap friendly recipe with 8 servings. One portion of this dish contains about 10g of protein, 28g of fat, and a total of 389 calories. For $1.81 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up vanillan extract, chile powder, salt, and a few other things to make it today. 6 people found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 57%. This score is pretty good. Try Steamy Hot Chocolate, Amaranth Pudding with Amaretto Cream, and Rice Pudding with Ginger, Amaranth, and Mango for similar recipes.
instructions: Whisk together first 5 ingredients and 1 tablespoon of the sugar in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook 25-30 minutes, uncovered and stirring frequently, until the amaranth is tender. Be careful not to let the milk boil over.Whisk together the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and eggs. Ladle about 1/2 cup of the hot amaranth mixture into the egg mixture, whisking constantly, to temper the eggs. Slowly whisk egg mixture into amaranth mixture in the pan. Cook 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Gradually add the chocolate, stirring until it melts.Fill a large bowl with ice water. Carefully set the pan into the ice bath and let the pudding cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally to prevent a skin from forming. Refrigerate at least 1 hour (pudding will continue to thicken as it chills). Serve garnished with chopped walnuts for added crunch.

steps.step: Whisk together first 5 ingredients and 1 tablespoon of the sugar in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook 25-30 minutes, uncovered and stirring frequently, until the amaranth is tender. Be careful not to let the milk boil over.

Whisk together the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and eggs. Ladle about 1/2 cup of the hot amaranth mixture into the egg mixture, whisking constantly, to temper the eggs. Slowly whisk egg mixture into amaranth mixture in the pan. Cook 1 minute or until thickened.

Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Gradually add the chocolate, stirring until it melts.Fill a large bowl with ice water. Carefully set the pan into the ice bath and let the pudding cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally to prevent a skin from forming. Refrigerate at least 1 hour (pudding will continue to thicken as it chills).
Serve garnished with chopped walnuts for added crunch.
